What is the definition of denotation?
The act of deleting a note or annotation
The strict, literal, dictionary definition of a word
An idea or feeling that a word invokes in addition to its literal or primary meaning
What is the definition of diction?
Refers to the writer's word choices, especially with regard to their correctness, clearness, or effectiveness
A specific genre of fiction known for dramatic portayals of love and death
What is the definition of didactic?
Filled with or characterized by a lively energy and excitement
Works that have the primary aim of teaching or instructing, especially the teaching of morals or ethic principles
Displaying or indicative of an offensively condescending manner
One who frequents (a store, theater, restaurant, or other establishment) as a customer
What is the definition of euphemism?
The painless killing of a patient suffering from an incurable and painful disease or in an irreversible coma. The practice is illegal in most countries
A word or phrase considered pleasing to the ear
A feeling or state of intense excitement and happiness
A more agreeable or less offensive substitute for a generally unpleasant word or concept
What is the definition of extended metaphor?
Any metaphor longer than a sentence
A metaphor developed at great length, occurrng frequently in or throughout a book
Another word for a theme present throughout a novel
A metaphor that is used for more than a page to drive a specific point regarding the plot of a novel
What is the definition of figurative language?
Speech or word use unfamiliar to an audience
The act of learning a language through exposure as opposed to formal learning
Writing or speech that is not intended to carry literal meaning and is usually meant to be imaginative and vivid
A vernacular developed over many years and differing greatly from its origin tongue
